episodes.title: Book Review: Crimson Death by Laurell K. Hamilton
episodes.author: Josh Roseman
episodes.summary: Well, Laurell K. Hamilton has done it again. She's written a pretty decent police procedural and then tacked on about 300 pages of relationship angst. Yes, that's right, it's time for me to review Crimson Death, the latest Anita Blake novel.

episodes.title: Escape Pod Flash Fiction Contest 2016
episodes.author: Mat
episodes.summary: Thirteen districts rebelled against the country that fed them, loved them, protected them. Brother turned on brother until nothing remained. And then came the peace, hard fought, sorely won. A people rose up from the ashes and a new era was born. But freedom has a cost. When the traitors were defeated, we swore as […]

episodes.summary: After years of great service, Arri and Kimi who run Poddisc for us have decided to step away. This means that PodDisc, our CD fulfillment site, will be shutting down in early February. That means two things. First, if you’re a PodDisc customer – and we know lots of you are, and thanks for that – now is […]

episodes.title: Book Review: Libertaria: Genesis by Sabrina Peña Young
episodes.author: Josh Roseman
episodes.summary: Award-winning composer Sabrina Peña Young sourced the entire world for her virtual production of Libertaria. But Young has taken her opera one step further, converting the show into a novel, Libertaria: Genesis.

episodes.title: Book Review: Murder with Monsters by KT Katzmann
episodes.author: Josh Roseman
episodes.summary: A lot of authors have subverted classic horror tropes, but author KT Katzmann has chosen instead to be aware of them and use their power for good, instead of evil, in his genre detective novel Murder with Monsters.

episodes.title: Book Review: Snapshot by Beau Hall
episodes.author: Josh Roseman
episodes.summary: Marietta, Georgia, isn't a small town anymore. But fifty years ago it was, and fifty years ago Mary Frances began blackmailing Marvin Hill into becoming a serial killer. Now, in Beau Hall's new novel Snapshot, Marvin wants out. By any means necessary.

episodes.title: Fan Film Review: Star Trek: Renegades
episodes.author: Josh Roseman
episodes.summary: After the success of Of Gods and Men, Tim Russ returns to the fan film arena with Star Trek: Renegades. Though I had high expectations, I think I expected more than what I got. Especially from the writing.

episodes.title: Book Review: The Shepherd’s Crown by Terry Pratchett
episodes.author: Josh Roseman
episodes.summary: On September 1, my Kindle automatically downloaded my preordered copy of The Shepherd's Crown. By September 3, I'd finished reading the final Discworld novel. Now the book is closed on the Discworld, at least in this form, and... well... I don't think I can wrap my head around that.

episodes.title: Artemis Rising Returns!
episodes.author: Nathaniel Lee
episodes.summary: The year-long orbit is about to end, and the good ship Artemis returns to Escape Pod’s skies. Artemis Rising is a month-long celebration of the voices of women in science fiction. It is also a collaborative effort across the Escape Artists podcasts, including PodCastle and Pseudopod. Last year we received so many awesome submissions that […]

episodes.title: Film Review: Mr. Holmes
episodes.author: Josh Roseman
episodes.summary: With as much Sherlock Holmes as I've read, you'd think I'd have gotten around to a version of the story where Holmes is nearing the end of his life. I haven't... until now, with the new film Mr. Holmes.
tags: a slight trick of the mind

episodes.title: Call for Submissions: Artemis Rising II
episodes.author: Graeme Dunlop
episodes.summary: In 2016, Escape Artists will again celebrate ARTEMIS RISING, a special month-long event across all three Escape Artists podcasts featuring stories by some of the best female and non-binary authors in genre fiction. Escape Pod will fill the entire month with female-authored science fiction. Payment will be $.06 per word for original fiction, and $100 for reprints. […]

episodes.title: Book Review: Dead Ice by Laurell K. Hamilton
episodes.author: Josh Roseman
episodes.summary: After finishing Dead Ice, the latest Anita Blake novel, I'm worried that things are backsliding a little toward the muddled middle of the series. And that's not good.
